definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: I like all kinds of stuff. I admit I love romance.
sentences.chinese: 我什麼種類的都喜歡，我承認我愛極文藝愛情片了。

sentences.english: Do take your lover to see a romantic story.
sentences.chinese: 帶你的愛人一起去看愛情片。

sentences.english: I also like romance and comedy movies very much.
sentences.chinese: 我也很喜歡愛情片和喜劇片。

sentences.english: B: I like all kinds of stuff. I admit I love romance.
sentences.chinese: 我什麼種類的都喜歡，我承認我愛極文藝愛情片了。

sentences.english: This is a love story about some young high school students.
sentences.chinese: 我是一部關於高中青年學生的愛情片。

sentences.english: If you like action, don't watch a romance.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜歡動作片，就不要去看愛情片。

sentences.english: I often see a romance or science fiction. And today I'd like to have a change .
sentences.chinese: 愛情片和科幻片經常看，今天就換一下口味吧。

sentences.english: What's the chick flick you secretly love?
sentences.chinese: 你最喜歡的愛情片是哪部？

definition: Brokeback Mountain, 2005 English-language film by Ang Lee 李安[Li3 An1]
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
Les Misérables (1862) by Victor Hugo 維克多·雨果|维克多·雨果[Wei2 ke4 duo1 · Yu3 guo3]
lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
